clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical and Radiographic Outcomes of TLIF w/3D Printed Cellular Implant
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical and Radiographic Outcomes of Transforaminal Lumbar Interbody Fusion (TLIF) With a Novel 3D Printed Cellular Titanium Implant

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to evaluate clinical outcomes and spine fusion rates for patients undergoing transforaminal lumbar interbody fusion using the CONDUIT 3D printed titanium TLIF cage.

detailed_description.textblock: This prospective, single-center study is being conducted as a post market evaluation of the CONDUIT 3D printed titanium TLIF Cage. Patients undergoing transforaminal lumbar interbody fusions due to lumbar spinal pathology (i.e. central foraminal stenosis, degenerative disc disease, and/or lumbar spondylolisthesis) and have failed conservative care will be recruited for this study. Patients will be serially evaluated at 6 month intervals for a total of 24 months post index procedure to assess patient reported outcomes, clinical outcomes, and radiographic parameter, specifically spine fusion rates.

primary_outcome.description: Fusion success measured by radiological assessment. Evidence of fusion demonstrated by bone formation through the cage on anteroposterior (AP) and Lateral radiographs, Flexion and Extension radiographs at 18 months

Fusion success measured by radiological assessment. Evidence of fusion demonstrated by bone formation through the cage on anteroposterior (AP) and Lateral radiographs, Flexion and Extension radiographs at 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Back and Leg Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement in the VAS as measured by a minimum of a 20 point improvement

Clinical Improvement will be defined by improvement in Oswestry Disability Index (ODI) >20%
Clinical Improvement will be defined by improvement in Oswestry Disability Index (ODI) >20%
Clinical Improvement will be defined by improvement in Oswestry Disability Index (ODI) >20%
Number of procedure and device related adverse events
Rates of reoperation and/or revision procedures at index level(s)

arm_group.arm_group_label: 1-2 contiguous levels of interbody fixation from a transforaminal approach for spinal segments L2-S1
arm_group.description: One to two contiguous levels of interbody fixation from a transforaminal approach for spinal segments L2-S1 whose condition requires the use of interbody fusion.

intervention.intervention_name: CONDUIT™ Interbody Platform composed of the EIT (Emerging Implant Technologies) Cellular Titanium®
intervention.description: Patients undergoing 1-2 contiguous levels of interbody fixation from a transforaminal approach for spinal segments L2-S1
intervention.arm_group_label: 1-2 contiguous levels of interbody fixation from a transforaminal approach for spinal segments L2-S1

study_pop.textblock: Patients will be skeletally mature adults ages 35-80 years of age undergoing one or two level transforaminal lumbar interbody fusion. These patients will have a diagnosis of lumbar degenerative disc disease with or without neurologic deficit and associated central and/or unilateral /bilateral foraminal stenosis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Skeletally mature adults ages 35 - 80 years of age, inclusive
- Diagnosis of lumbar degenerative disc disease with or without neurologic deficit and associated central and/or unilateral/bilateral foraminal stenosis
- Subject undergoing one or two level transforaminal lumbar interbody fusion
- Able to read and understand all documents used in this study , including the informed consent and patient-reported outcome questionnaires
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients over 80 years of age
- Patients under 35 years of age
- Current smokers
- BMI>42
- Subject has spondylolisthesis > 2
- Subjects with multilevel >2 levels of symptomatic disease
- Subjects with significant spinal deformity
- Subject is pregnant, plans to become pregnant or is breast feeding

overall_official.affiliation: Hartford Hospital; Hartford Healthcare Bone & Joint Institute
